standard_metadata.standard_description: Represent three-dimensional figures using nets made up of rectangles and triangles, and use the nets to find the surface area of these figures. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

question.content: **Find the surface area of the cube shown below.**   units$^2$

images.alt: A cube. The height is 2 thirds unit.

hints.content: Let's draw a net of the cube.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A net on a coordinate grid.  The net consists of 6 squares. All of the squares have side lengths of 2 thirds unit. 4 of the squares are are in a row. There is a square connected to the top and a square connected to the bottom of the second square, each with side lengths of 2 thirds unit.

hints.content: All  $6$ of the faces are squares.  >$\begin{align} \text{Area of a square} &=  \text{side} \cdot \text{side}\\\\ &= \dfrac23 \cdot \dfrac23\\\\ &= \dfrac{2 \cdot2}{3 \cdot 3} \\\\ &= \blueD{\dfrac{4}{9}}\\\\ \end{align}$

>$\begin{align} \text{Surface area of a cube} &=  6 \cdot \blueD{\text{Area of a square}}\\\\ &= 6 \cdot \blueD{\dfrac{4}{9}}\\\\ &= \dfrac{6 \cdot4}{ 9} \\\\ &= \dfrac{\stackrel{2}{\cancel{6}}\cdot4 }{\underset{3}{\cancel9}}\\\\ &=\dfrac{2 \cdot 4}{3}\\\\ &= \dfrac{8}{3} \end{align}$
The surface area of the cube is $\dfrac{8}{3}$ units$^2$.

question.content: **Find the surface area of the cube shown below.**   units$^2$

images.alt: A cube. The height is 2 and 1 half units.

hints.content: Let's draw a net of the cube.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A net on a coordinate grid.  The net consists of 6 squares. All of the squares have side lengths of 2 and 1 half units. 4 of the squares are are in a row. There is a square connected to the top and a square connected to the bottom of the second square, each with side lengths of 2 and 1 half units.

hints.content: All  $6$ of the faces are squares.  >$\begin{align} \text{Area of a square} &=  \text{side} \cdot \text{side}\\\\ &= 2 \dfrac12 \cdot 2 \dfrac12\\\\ &= \dfrac52 \cdot \dfrac52\\\\ &= \dfrac{5 \cdot5}{2 \cdot 2} \\\\ &= \blueD{\dfrac{25}{4}}\\\\ \end{align}$

>$\begin{align} \text{Surface area of a cube} &=  6 \cdot \blueD{\text{Area of a square}}\\\\ &= 6 \cdot \blueD{\dfrac{25}{4}}\\\\ &= \dfrac{6 \cdot25}{ 4} \\\\ &= \dfrac{\stackrel{3}{\cancel{6}}\cdot25 }{\underset{2}{\cancel4}}\\\\ &=\dfrac{3 \cdot 25}{2}\\\\ &= \dfrac{75}{2} \end{align}$
The surface area of the cube is $\dfrac{75}{2}$ units$^2$.

question.content: The present shown below is a cube.    **Find the surface area of the present.**   $\text{ cm}^2$

images.alt: A gift that is a cube. The side lengths are 20 centimeters.

hints.content: Let's draw a net of the present.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A net on a coordinate grid.  The net consists of 6 squares. All of the squares have side lengths of 20 units. 4 of the squares are are in a row. There is a square connected to the top and a square connected to the bottom of the second square, each with side lengths of 20 units.

hints.content: All  $6$ of the faces are squares.  $\begin{align} \text{Area of a square} &=  \text{side} \cdot \text{side}\\\\ &= 20 \cdot 20\\\\ &= \blueE{400} \end{align}$
$\begin{align} \text{Surface area of a cube} &=  6 \cdot \blueE{\text{Area of a square}}\\\\ &= 6 \cdot \blueE{400}\\\\ &= 2{,}400 \end{align}$
The surface area of the present is $2{,}400 \text{ cm}^2$.

question.content: The present shown below is a cube.    **Find the surface area of the present.**   $\text{ cm}^2$

images.alt: A gift that is a cube. The side lengths are 15 centimeters.

hints.content: Let's draw a net of the present.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A net on a coordinate grid.  The net consists of 6 squares. All of the squares have side lengths of 15 units. 4 of the squares are are in a row. There is a square connected to the top and a square connected to the bottom of the second square, each with side lengths of 15 units.

hints.content: All  $6$ of the faces are squares.  $\begin{align} \text{Area of a square} &=  \text{side} \cdot \text{side}\\\\ &= 15 \cdot 15\\\\ &= \blueE{225} \end{align}$
$\begin{align} \text{Surface area of a cube} &=  6 \cdot \blueE{\text{Area of a square}}\\\\ &= 6 \cdot \blueE{225}\\\\ &= 1{,}350 \end{align}$
The surface area of the present is $1{,}350 \text{ cm}^2$.

question.content: **Find the surface area of the right rectangular prism shown below.**   units$^2$

images.alt: A rectangular prism. The length is 2.5 units. The width is 4 units. The height is 2 units.

hints.content: Let's draw a net of the rectangular prism.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A net that consists of 6 rectangles.  4 of the rectangles are connected by the long side.  The first rectangle has a base of 2 units and a height of 4 units.  The second rectangle has a base of 2.5 units and a height of 4 units. The third rectangle has a base of 2 units and a height of 4 units.  The fourth rectangle has a base of 2.5 units and a height of 4 units. There is a rectangle connected to the top and a rectangle connected to the bottom of the second rectangle, each with a base of 2.5 units and a height of 2 units.

hints.content: Each of the sides is a $4$ by $2$ rectangle.   >$\begin{align} \text{Area of a rectangle} &=  \text{length} \cdot \text{width}\\\\ &= 4 \cdot 2\\\\ &= {8} \\\\ \end{align}$  The total area of the sides  is $2 \cdot 8 = \blueD{16}$.

The bottom and the top are both $4$ by $2.5$ rectangles.  >$\begin{align} \text{Area of a rectangle} &=  \text{length} \cdot \text{width}\\\\ &= 4 \cdot 2.5\\\\ &= {10} \\\\ \end{align}$  The total area of the bottom and the top is $2 \cdot 10 = \greenD{20}$.

The back and the front are both $2$ by $2.5$ rectangles.   >$\begin{align} \text{Area of a rectangle} &=  \text{length} \cdot \text{width}\\\\ &= 2 \cdot 2.5\\\\ &= {5} \\\\ \end{align}$  The total area of the back and the front  is $2 \cdot 5 = \goldD{10}$.
Let's add the areas to find the surface area.  >$\begin{align} \text{Surface area} &= \blueD{16}+ \greenD{20} + \goldD{10} \\\\ &= 46\\\\ \end{align}$
The surface area of the rectangular prism is $46$ units$^2$.

question.content: **Find the surface area of the right rectangular prism shown below.**   units$^2$

images.alt: A rectangular prism. The length is 5 units. The width is 4 units. The height is 1.5 units.

hints.content: Let's draw a net of the rectangular prism.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A net that consists of 6 rectangles.  4 of the rectangles are connected by the long side.  The first rectangle has a base of 1.5 units and a height of 4 units.  The second rectangle has a base of 5 units and a height of 4 units. The third rectangle has a base of 1.5 units and a height of 4 units.  The fourth rectangle has a base of 5 units and a height of 4 units. There is a rectangle connected to the top and a rectangle connected to the bottom of the second rectangle, each with a base of 5 units and a height of 1.5 units.

hints.content: Each of the sides is a $4$ by $1.5$ rectangle.   >$\begin{align} \text{Area of a rectangle} &=  \text{length} \cdot \text{width}\\\\ &= 4 \cdot 1.5\\\\ &= {6} \\\\ \end{align}$  The total area of the sides  is $2 \cdot 6 = \blueD{12}$.

The bottom and the top are both $4$ by $5$ rectangles.  >$\begin{align} \text{Area of a rectangle} &=  \text{length} \cdot \text{width}\\\\ &= 4 \cdot 5\\\\ &= {20} \\\\ \end{align}$  The total area of bottom and the top is $2 \cdot 20 = \greenD{40}$.

The back and the front are both $1.5$ by $5$ rectangles.   >$\begin{align} \text{Area of a rectangle} &=  \text{length} \cdot \text{width}\\\\ &= 1.5 \cdot 5\\\\ &= {7.5} \\\\ \end{align}$  The total area of the back and the front  is $2 \cdot 7.5 = \goldD{15}$.
Let's add the areas to find the surface area.  >$\begin{align} \text{Surface area} &= \blueD{12}+ \greenD{40} + \goldD{15} \\\\ &= 67\\\\ \end{align}$
The surface area of the rectangular prism is $67$ units$^2$.

question.content: The cereal box shown below is a rectangular prism.    **Find the surface area of the cereal box.**   $\text{ cm}^2$

images.alt: A cereal box that is a rectangular prism. The length is 20 centimeters. The width is 5 centimeters. The height is 30 centimeters.

hints.content: Let's draw a net of the cereal box.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A net that consists of 6 rectangles.  4 of the rectangles are connected by the short side.  The first rectangle has a base of 30 units and a height of 5 units.  The second rectangle has a base of 20 units and a height of 5 units. The third rectangle has a base of 30 units and a height of 5 units.  The fourth rectangle has a base of 20 units and a height of 5 units. There is a rectangle connected to the top and a rectangle connected to the bottom of the second rectangle, each with a base of 20 units and a height of 30 units.

hints.content: Each of the sides is a $5$ by $30$ rectangle.   $\begin{align} \text{Area of a rectangle} &=  \text{length} \cdot \text{width}\\\\ &= 5 \cdot 30\\\\ &= {150} \end{align}$  The total area of the sides  is $2 \cdot 150 = \blueE{300}$.

The bottom and the top are both $5$ by $20$ rectangles.  $\begin{align} \text{Area of a rectangle} &=  \text{length} \cdot \text{width}\\\\ &= 5 \cdot 20\\\\ &= {100} \end{align}$  The total area of the bottom and the top is $2 \cdot 100 = \purpleD{200}$.

The back and the front are both $30$ by $20$ rectangles.  $\begin{align} \text{Area of a rectangle} &=  \text{length} \cdot \text{width}\\\\ &= 30 \cdot 20\\\\ &= {600} \end{align}$  The total area of the back and the front  is $2 \cdot 600 = \goldE{1{,}200}$.
Let's add the areas we found to find the surface area.  $\begin{align} \text{Surface area} &= \blueE{300}+ \purpleD{200} + \goldE{1{,}200} \\\\ &= 1{,}700 \end{align}$
The surface area of the cereal box is $1{,}700\text{ cm}^2$.

question.content: The cereal box shown below is a rectangular prism.    **Find the surface area of the cereal box.**   $\text{ cm}^2$

images.alt: A cereal box that is a rectangular prism. The length is 15 centimeters. The width is 4 centimeters. The height is 25 centimeters.

hints.content: Let's draw a net of the cereal box.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A net that consists of 6 rectangles.  4 of the rectangles are connected by the short side.  The first rectangle has a base of 25 units and a height of 4 units.  The second rectangle has a base of 15 units and a height of 4 units. The third rectangle has a base of 25 units and a height of 4 units.  The fourth rectangle has a base of 15 units and a height of 4 units. There is a rectangle connected to the top and a rectangle connected to the bottom of the second rectangle, each with a base of 15 units and a height of 25 units.

hints.content: Each of the sides is a $4$ by $25$ rectangle.   $\begin{align} \text{Area of a rectangle} &=  \text{length} \cdot \text{width}\\\\ &= 4 \cdot 25\\\\ &= {100} \end{align}$  The total area of the sides  is $2 \cdot 100 = \blueE{200}$.

The bottom and the top are both $4$ by $15$ rectangles.  $\begin{align} \text{Area of a rectangle} &=  \text{length} \cdot \text{width}\\\\ &= 4 \cdot 15\\\\ &= {60} \end{align}$  The total area of the bottom and the top is $2 \cdot 60 = \purpleD{120}$.

The back and the front are both $25$ by $15$ rectangles.  $\begin{align} \text{Area of a rectangle} &=  \text{length} \cdot \text{width}\\\\ &= 25 \cdot 15\\\\ &= {375} \end{align}$  The total area of the back and the front  is $2 \cdot 375 = \goldE{750}$.
Let's add the areas we found to find the surface area.  $\begin{align} \text{Surface area} &= \blueE{200}+ \purpleD{120} + \goldE{750} \\\\ &= 1{,}070 \end{align}$
The surface area of the cereal box is $1{,}070\text{ cm}^2$.

question.content: The cereal box shown below is a rectangular prism.    **Find the surface area of the cereal box.**   $\text{ cm}^2$

images.alt: A cereal box that is a rectangular prism. The length is 10 centimeters. The width is 3 centimeters. The height is 20 centimeters.

hints.content: Let's draw a net of the cereal box.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A net that consists of 6 rectangles.  4 of the rectangles are connected by the short side.  The first rectangle has a base of 20 units and a height of 3 units.  The second rectangle has a base of 10 units and a height of 3 units. The third rectangle has a base of 20 units and a height of 3 units.  The fourth rectangle has a base of 10 units and a height of 3 units. There is a rectangle connected to the top and a rectangle connected to the bottom of the second rectangle, each with a base of 10 units and a height of 20 units.

hints.content: Each of the sides is a $3$ by $20$ rectangle.   $\begin{align} \text{Area of a rectangle} &=  \text{length} \cdot \text{width}\\\\ &= 3 \cdot 20\\\\ &= {60} \end{align}$  The total area of the sides  is $2 \cdot 60 = \blueE{120}$.

The bottom and the top are both $3$ by $10$ rectangles.  $\begin{align} \text{Area of a rectangle} &=  \text{length} \cdot \text{width}\\\\ &= 3 \cdot 10\\\\ &= {30} \end{align}$  The total area of the bottom and the top is $2 \cdot 30 = \purpleD{60}$.

The back and the front are both $20$ by $10$ rectangles.  $\begin{align} \text{Area of a rectangle} &=  \text{length} \cdot \text{width}\\\\ &= 20 \cdot 10\\\\ &= {200} \end{align}$  The total area of the back and the front  is $2 \cdot 200 = \goldE{400}$.
Let's add the areas we found to find the surface area.  $\begin{align} \text{Surface area} &= \blueE{120}+ \purpleE{60} + \goldE{400} \\\\ &= 580 \end{align}$
The surface area of the cereal box is $580\text{ cm}^2$.

question.content: **Find the surface area of the right triangular prism shown below.**   units$^2$

images.alt: A right triangular prism. The bottom face has side lengths of 4 units and 11 units. The side face has side lengths of 3 units and 11 units. The diagonal side face has side lengths of 5 units and 11 units. The triangular prism has a height of 3 units.

hints.content: Let's draw a net of the triangular prism.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A net that consists of 3 rectangles and 2 right triangles.  The rectangles are connected by the long side.  The first rectangle has a base of 3 units and a height of 11 units.  The second rectangle has a base of 4 units and a height of 11 units. The third rectangle has a base of 5 units and a height of 11 units.  There is a right triangle connected to the top and bottom of the second rectangle.  Each right triangle has a base of 4 units and a height of 3 units.

hints.content: $1$ of the faces is an $11$ by $3$ rectangle.  >$\begin{align} \text{Area of a rectangle} &=  \text{length} \cdot \text{width}\\\\ &= 11 \cdot 3\\\\ &= {\blueD{33}} \\\\ \end{align}$
$1$ of the faces is an $11$ by $4$ rectangle.  >$\begin{align} \text{Area of a rectangle} &=  \text{length} \cdot \text{width}\\\\ &= 11 \cdot 4\\\\ &= {\greenD{44}} \\\\ \end{align}$
$1$ of the faces is an $11$ by $5$ rectangle.  >$\begin{align} \text{Area of a rectangle} &=  \text{length} \cdot \text{width}\\\\ &= 11 \cdot 5\\\\ &= {\goldD{55}} \\\\ \end{align}$

$2$ of the faces are triangles. Each triangle has the same base and height.  >$\begin{align} \text{Area of a triangle} &=  \dfrac12 \cdot \text{base} \cdot \text{height}\\\\ &= \dfrac12 \cdot 4 \cdot 3\\\\ &= 6 \\\\ \end{align}$   The total area of these $2$ triangles is $2 \cdot 6 = \maroonD{12}$.
Let's add the areas to find the surface area.  >$\begin{align} \text{Surface area} &= \blueD{33}+ \greenD{44} + \goldD{55} + \maroonD{12} \\\\ &= 144\\\\ \end{align}$
The surface area of the triangular prism is $144$ units$^2$.

question.content: **Find the surface area of the triangular prism shown below.**     units$^2$

images.alt: A triangular prism. The bottom face has side lengths of 6 units and 7 units. The other 2 faces have side lengths of 5 units and 7 units. The triangular prism has a height of 4 units.

hints.content: Let's draw a net of the triangular prism.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A net that consists of 3 rectangles and 2 triangles.  The rectangles are connected by the long side.  The first rectangle has a base of 5 units and a height of 7 units.  The second rectangle has a base of 6 units and a height of 7 units. The third rectangle has a base of 5 units and a height of 7 units.  There is a triangle connected to the top and bottom of the second rectangle.  Each triangle has a base of 6 units and a height of 4 units.

hints.content: $2$ of the faces are $7$ by $5$ rectangles.   $\begin{align} \text{Area of a rectangle} &=  \text{length} \cdot \text{width}\\\\ &= 7 \cdot 5\\\\ &= {35} \end{align}$  The total area of these $2$ rectangles  is $2 \cdot 35 = \maroonD{70}$.
$1$ of the faces is a $7$ by $6$ rectangle.  $\begin{align} \text{Area of a rectangle} &=  \text{length} \cdot \text{width}\\\\ &= 7 \cdot 6\\\\ &= \purpleD{42} \end{align}$

$2$ of the faces are triangles. Each triangle has the same base and height.  $\begin{align} \text{Area of a triangle} &=  \dfrac12 \cdot \text{base} \cdot \text{height}\\\\ &= \dfrac12 \cdot 6 \cdot 4\\\\ &= 12 \end{align}$  The total area of these $2$ triangles is $2 \cdot 12 = \goldE{24}$.
Let's add the areas to find the surface area.  $\begin{align} \text{Surface area} &= \maroonD{70}+ \purpleD{42} + \goldE{24} \\\\ &= 136 \end{align}$
The surface area of the triangular prism is $136$ units$^2$.

question.content: **Find the surface area of the triangular prism shown below.**     units$^2$

images.alt: A triangular prism. The bottom face has side lengths of 12 units and 14 units. The other 2 faces have side lengths of 10 units and 14 units. The triangular prism has a height of 8 units.

hints.content: Let's draw a net of the triangular prism.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A net that consists of 3 rectangles and 2 triangles.  The rectangles are connected by the long side.  The first rectangle has a base of 10 units and a height of 14 units.  The second rectangle has a base of 12 units and a height of 14 units. The third rectangle has a base of 10 units and a height of 14 units.  There is a triangle connected to the top and bottom of the second rectangle.  Each triangle has a base of 12 units and a height of 8 units.

hints.content: $2$ of the faces are $14$ by $10$ rectangles.   $\begin{align} \text{Area of a rectangle} &=  \text{length} \cdot \text{width}\\\\ &= 14 \cdot 10\\\\ &= {140} \end{align}$  The total area of these $2$ rectangles  is $2 \cdot 140 = \maroonD{280}$.
$1$ of the faces is a $14$ by $12$ rectangle.  $\begin{align} \text{Area of a rectangle} &=  \text{length} \cdot \text{width}\\\\ &= 14 \cdot 12\\\\ &= \purpleD{168} \end{align}$

$2$ of the faces are triangles. Each triangle has the same base and height.  $\begin{align} \text{Area of a triangle} &=  \dfrac12 \cdot \text{base} \cdot \text{height}\\\\ &= \dfrac12 \cdot 12 \cdot 8\\\\ &= 48 \end{align}$  The total area of these $2$ triangles is $2 \cdot 48 = \goldE{96}$.
Let's add the areas to find the surface area.  $\begin{align} \text{Surface area} &= \maroonD{280}+ \purpleD{168} + \goldE{96} \\\\ &= 544 \end{align}$
The surface area of the triangular prism is $544$ units$^2$.

question.content: Cam's tent (shown below) is a triangular prism.    **Find the surface area, including the floor, of his tent.**   $\text{ m}^2$

images.alt: A triangular prism. A dashed line that is perpendicular to the base of the triangular face starts at the middle of the base and goes straight up to the top vertex to the triangle. This dashed line represents the height and is 1.7 meters. An arrow starts at the bottom, left vertex of the triangular face and ends at the dashed line. This length is 1 meter. An arrow starts at dashed line and ends at the bottom, right vertex of the triangular face. This length is 1 meter. The other 2 lengths of the triangular face are 2 meters. All 3 rectangular faces of the prism have side lengths of 2 meters and 3 meters.

hints.content: Let's draw a net of the tent.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A net that consists of 3 rectangles and 2 triangles.  The rectangles are connected by the long side.  The first rectangle has a base of 2 units and a height of 3 units.  The second rectangle has a base of 2 units and a height of 3 units. The third rectangle has a base of 2 units and a height of 3 units.  There is a triangle connected to the top and bottom of the second rectangle.  Each triangle has a base of 2 units and a height of 1.7 units. The height of each triangle is represented by the dashed line that is perpendicular to the base.

hints.content: $3$ of the faces are $3$ by $2$ rectangles.   $\begin{align} \text{Area of a rectangle} &=  \text{length} \cdot \text{width}\\\\ &= 3 \cdot 2\\\\ &= {6} \end{align}$  The total area of these $3$ rectangles  is $3 \cdot 6 = \blueE{18}$.

$2$ of the faces are triangles. Each triangle has the same base and height.  $\begin{align} \text{Area of a triangle} &=  \dfrac12 \cdot \text{base} \cdot \text{height}\\\\ &= \dfrac12 \cdot 2 \cdot 1.7\\\\ &= 1.7 \end{align}$  The total area of these $2$ triangles is $2 \cdot 1.7 = \goldE{3.4}$.
Let's add the areas we found to find the surface area.  $\begin{align} \text{Surface area} &= \blueE{18}+  \goldE{3.4} \\\\ &= 21.4 \end{align}$
The surface area of the tent is $21.4\text{ m}^2$.

question.content: Shaun's tent (shown below) is a triangular prism.    **Find the surface area, including the floor, of his tent.**   $\text{ m}^2$

images.alt: A triangular prism. A dashed line that is perpendicular to the base of the triangular face starts at the middle of the base and goes straight up to the top vertex to the triangle. This dashed line represents the height and is 2.6 meters. An arrow starts at the bottom, left vertex of the triangular face and ends at the dashed line. This length is 1.5 meters. An arrow starts at dashed line and ends at the bottom, right vertex of the triangular face. This length is 1.5 meters. The other 2 lengths of the triangular face are 3 meters. All 3 rectangular faces of the prism have side lengths of 3 meters and 5 meters.

hints.content: Let's draw a net of the tent.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A net that consists of 3 rectangles and 2 triangles.  The rectangles are connected by the long side.  The first rectangle has a base of 3 units and a height of 5 units.  The second rectangle has a base of 3 units and a height of 5 units. The third rectangle has a base of 3 units and a height of 5 units.  There is a triangle connected to the top and bottom of the second rectangle.  Each triangle has a base of 2 units and a height of 2.6 units. The height of each triangle is represented by the dashed line that is perpendicular to the base.

hints.content: $3$ of the faces are $5$ by $3$ rectangles.   $\begin{align} \text{Area of a rectangle} &=  \text{length} \cdot \text{width}\\\\ &= 5 \cdot 3\\\\ &= {15} \end{align}$  The total area of these $3$ rectangles  is $3 \cdot 15 = \blueE{45}$.

$2$ of the faces are triangles. Each triangle has the same base and height.  $\begin{align} \text{Area of a triangle} &=  \dfrac12 \cdot \text{base} \cdot \text{height}\\\\ &= \dfrac12 \cdot 3 \cdot 2.6\\\\ &= 3.9 \end{align}$  The total area of these $2$ triangles is $2 \cdot 3.9 = \goldE{7.8}$.
Let's add the areas we found to find the surface area.  $\begin{align} \text{Surface area} &= \blueE{45}+  \goldE{7.8} \\\\ &= 52.8 \end{align}$
The surface area of the tent is $52.8\text{ m}^2$.

question.content: **Find the surface area of the square pyramid shown below.**     units$^2$

images.alt: A square pyramid.  The side of the pyramid's base is 4 units long and the height of the triangular face measured from the center of the side of base to the apex is 3 units.

hints.content: Let's draw a net of the square pyramid.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A net that has 1 square and 4 triangles. Each triangle is attached to the 4 sides of the square. The side lengths of the square are 4 units. The base of each triangle is 4 units and the height is 3 units. The height of each triangle is represented by the dashed line that is perpendicular to the base of the triangle to the opposite vertex.

hints.content: $1$ of the faces is a square.  $\begin{align} \text{Area of a square} &=  \text{side} \cdot \text{side}\\\\ &= 4 \cdot 4\\\\ &= {\maroonD{16}} \end{align}$

$4$ of the faces are triangles. Each triangle has the same base and height.  $\begin{align} \text{Area of a triangle} &=  \dfrac12 \cdot \text{base} \cdot \text{height}\\\\ &= \dfrac12 \cdot 4 \cdot 3\\\\ &= 6 \end{align}$  The total area of these $4$ triangles is $4 \cdot 6 = \purpleD{24}$.
Let's add the areas to find the surface area.  $\begin{align} \text{Surface area} &= \maroonD{16}+ \purpleD{24}\\\\ &= 40 \end{align}$
The surface area of the square pyramid is $40$ units$^2$.

question.content: **Find the surface area of the square pyramid shown below.**     units$^2$

images.alt: A square pyramid.  The side of the pyramid's base is 8 units long and the height of the triangular face measured from the center of the side of base to the apex is 6 units.

hints.content: Let's draw a net of the square pyramid.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A net that has 1 square and 4 triangles. Each triangle is attached to the 4 sides of the square. The side lengths of the square are 8 units. The base of each triangle is 8 units and the height is 6 units. The height of each triangle is represented by the dashed line that is perpendicular to the base of the triangle to the opposite vertex.

hints.content: $1$ of the faces is a square.  $\begin{align} \text{Area of a square} &=  \text{side} \cdot \text{side}\\\\ &= 8 \cdot 8\\\\ &= {\maroonD{64}} \end{align}$

$4$ of the faces are triangles. Each triangle has the same base and height.  $\begin{align} \text{Area of a triangle} &=  \dfrac12 \cdot \text{base} \cdot \text{height}\\\\ &= \dfrac12 \cdot 8 \cdot 6\\\\ &= 24 \end{align}$  The total area of these $4$ triangles is $4 \cdot 24 = \purpleD{96}$.
Let's add the areas to find the surface area.  $\begin{align} \text{Surface area} &= \maroonD{64}+ \purpleD{96}\\\\ &= 160 \end{align}$
The surface area of the square pyramid is $160$ units$^2$.

question.content: Ben made a model (shown below) of the square pyramid he plans to build when he grows up.    **Find the surface area of the model.**   $\text{ m}^2$

images.alt: A square pyramid.  The side of the pyramid's base is 10 units long and the height of the triangular face measured from the center of the side of base to the apex is 7 units.

hints.content: Let's draw a net of the square pyramid.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A net that has 1 square and 4 triangles. Each triangle is attached to the 4 sides of the square. The side lengths of the square are 10 units. The base of each triangle is 10 units and the height is 7 units. The height of each triangle is represented by the dashed line that is perpendicular to the base of the triangle to the opposite vertex.

hints.content: $1$ of the faces is a square.  $\begin{align} \text{Area of a square} &=  \text{side} \cdot \text{side}\\\\ &= 10 \cdot 10\\\\ &= \blueE{100} \end{align}$

$4$ of the faces are triangles. Each triangle has the same base and height.  $\begin{align} \text{Area of a triangle} &=  \dfrac12 \cdot \text{base} \cdot \text{height}\\\\ &= \dfrac12 \cdot 10 \cdot 7\\\\ &= 35 \end{align}$  The total area of these $4$ triangles is $4 \cdot 35 = \purpleD{140}$.
Let's add the areas we found to find the surface area.  $\begin{align} \text{Surface area} &= \blueE{100}+ \purpleD{140}\\\\ &= 240 \end{align}$
The surface area of the square pyramid is $240\text{ m}^2$.

question.content: Marie made a model (shown below) of the square pyramid she plans to build when she grows up.     **Find the surface area of the model.**   $\text{ m}^2$

images.alt: A square pyramid.  The side of the pyramid's base is 12 units long and the height of the triangular face measured from the center of the side of base to the apex is 8 units.

hints.content: Let's draw a net of the square pyramid.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A net that has 1 square and 4 triangles. Each triangle is attached to the 4 sides of the square. The side lengths of the square are 12 units. The base of each triangle is 12 units and the height is 8 units. The height of each triangle is represented by the dashed line that is perpendicular to the base of the triangle to the opposite vertex.

hints.content: $1$ of the faces is a square.  $\begin{align} \text{Area of a square} &=  \text{side} \cdot \text{side}\\\\ &= 12 \cdot 12\\\\ &= \blueE{144} \end{align}$

$4$ of the faces are triangles. Each triangle has the same base and height.  $\begin{align} \text{Area of a triangle} &=  \dfrac12 \cdot \text{base} \cdot \text{height}\\\\ &= \dfrac12 \cdot 12 \cdot 8\\\\ &= 48 \end{align}$  The total area of these $4$ triangles is $4 \cdot 48 = \purpleD{192}$.
Let's add the areas we found to find the surface area.  $\begin{align} \text{Surface area} &= \blueE{144}+ \purpleD{192}\\\\ &= 336 \end{align}$
The surface area of the square pyramid is $336\text{ m}^2$.

question.content: Marie made a model (shown below) of the square pyramid she plans to build when she grows up.    **Find the surface area of the model.**   $\text{ m}^2$

images.alt: A square pyramid.  The side of the pyramid's base is 8 units long and the height of the triangular face measured from the center of the side of base to the apex is 5 units.

hints.content: Let's draw a net of the square pyramid.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A net that has 1 square and 4 triangles. Each triangle is attached to the 4 sides of the square. The side lengths of the square are 8 units. The base of each triangle is 8 units and the height is 5 units. The height of each triangle is represented by the dashed line that is perpendicular to the base of the triangle to the opposite vertex.

hints.content: $1$ of the faces is a square.  $\begin{align} \text{Area of a square} &=  \text{side} \cdot \text{side}\\\\ &= 8 \cdot 8\\\\ &= {\blueE{64}} \end{align}$

$4$ of the faces are triangles. Each triangle has the same base and height.  $\begin{align} \text{Area of a triangle} &=  \dfrac12 \cdot \text{base} \cdot \text{height}\\\\ &= \dfrac12 \cdot 8 \cdot 5\\\\ &= 20 \end{align}$  The total area of these $4$ triangles is $4 \cdot 20 = \purpleD{80}$.
Let's add the areas we found to find the surface area.  $\begin{align} \text{Surface area} &= \blueE{64}+ \purpleD{80}\\\\ &= 144 \end{align}$
The surface area of the square pyramid is $144\text{ m}^2$.
